packageMeta.name: purescript-datetime
packageMeta.description: PureScript library for date and time values

declarations.comments:
A year component for a date.

The constructor is private as the `Year` type is bounded to the range
-271820 to 275759, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire a year value from an integer.
declarations.title: Year

declarations.comments: A type representing the days of the week in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Weekday

declarations.comments: A month component for a date in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Month

declarations.comments:
A day component for a date.

The constructor is private as the `Day` type is bounded to the range
1 to 31, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire a day value from an integer.
declarations.title: Day

declarations.comments: A date value in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Date

declarations.comments:
Constructs a date from year, month, and day components. The resulting date
components may not be identical to the input values, as the date will be
canonicalised according to the Gregorian calendar. For example, date
values for the invalid date 2016-02-31 will be corrected to 2016-03-02.
declarations.title: canonicalDate

declarations.comments:
Constructs a date from year, month, and day components. The result will be
`Nothing` if the provided values result in an invalid date.
declarations.title: exactDate

declarations.comments: The year component of a date value.
declarations.title: year

declarations.comments: The month component of a date value.
declarations.title: month

declarations.comments: The day component of a date value.
declarations.title: day

declarations.comments: The weekday for a date value.
declarations.title: weekday

declarations.comments:
Calculates the difference between two dates, returning the result as a
duration.
declarations.title: diff

declarations.comments: Is this year a leap year according to the proleptic Gregorian calendar?
declarations.title: isLeapYear

declarations.comments:
A year component for a date.

The constructor is private as the `Year` type is bounded to the range
-271820 to 275759, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire a year value from an integer.
declarations.title: Year

declarations.comments: A month component for a date in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Month

declarations.comments:
A day component for a date.

The constructor is private as the `Day` type is bounded to the range
1 to 31, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire a day value from an integer.
declarations.title: Day

declarations.comments: A type representing the days of the week in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Weekday

declarations.comments:
A year component for a date.

The constructor is private as the `Year` type is bounded to the range
-271820 to 275759, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire a year value from an integer.
declarations.title: Year

declarations.comments: A type representing the days of the week in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Weekday

declarations.comments: A month component for a date in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Month

declarations.comments:
A day component for a date.

The constructor is private as the `Day` type is bounded to the range
1 to 31, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire a day value from an integer.
declarations.title: Day

declarations.comments: A date value in the Gregorian calendar.
declarations.title: Date

declarations.comments: The year component of a date value.
declarations.title: year

declarations.comments: The weekday for a date value.
declarations.title: weekday

declarations.comments: The month component of a date value.
declarations.title: month

declarations.comments:
Constructs a date from year, month, and day components. The result will be
`Nothing` if the provided values result in an invalid date.
declarations.title: exactDate

declarations.comments: The day component of a date value.
declarations.title: day

declarations.comments:
Constructs a date from year, month, and day components. The resulting date
components may not be identical to the input values, as the date will be
canonicalised according to the Gregorian calendar. For example, date
values for the invalid date 2016-02-31 will be corrected to 2016-03-02.
declarations.title: canonicalDate

declarations.comments:
An second component for a time value.

The constructor is private as values for the type are restricted to the
range 0 to 59, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire an `Second` value from an integer. Correspondingly, a `Second` can
be lowered to a plain integer with the `fromEnum` function.
declarations.title: Second

declarations.comments:
An minute component for a time value.

The constructor is private as values for the type are restricted to the
range 0 to 59, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire an `Minute` value from an integer. Correspondingly, a `Minute` can
be lowered to a plain integer with the `fromEnum` function.
declarations.title: Minute

declarations.comments:
An millisecond component for a time value.

The constructor is private as values for the type are restricted to the
range 0 to 999, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire an `Millisecond` value from an integer. Correspondingly, a
`Millisecond` can be lowered to a plain integer with the `fromEnum`
function.
declarations.title: Millisecond

declarations.comments:
An hour component for a time value.

The constructor is private as values for the type are restricted to the
range 0 to 23, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire an `Hour` value from an integer. Correspondingly, an `Hour` can be
lowered to a plain integer with the `fromEnum` function.
declarations.title: Hour

declarations.comments: Alters the second component of a time value.
declarations.title: setSecond

declarations.comments: Alters the minute component of a time value.
declarations.title: setMinute

declarations.comments: Alters the millisecond component of a time value.
declarations.title: setMillisecond

declarations.comments: Alters the hour component of a time value.
declarations.title: setHour

declarations.comments: The second component of a time value.
declarations.title: second

declarations.comments: The minute component of a time value.
declarations.title: minute

declarations.comments: The millisecond component of a time value.
declarations.title: millisecond

declarations.comments: The hour component of a time value.
declarations.title: hour

declarations.comments: A date/time value in the Gregorian calendar/UTC time zone.
declarations.title: DateTime

declarations.comments:
Adjusts a date/time value with a duration offset. `Nothing` is returned
if the resulting date would be outside of the range of valid dates.
declarations.title: adjust

declarations.comments:
Calculates the difference between two date/time values, returning the
result as a duration.
declarations.title: diff

declarations.comments:
An instant is a duration in milliseconds relative to the Unix epoch
(1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC).

The constructor is private as the `Instant` range matches that of the
`DateTime` type.
declarations.title: Instant

declarations.comments:
Attempts to create an `Instant` from a `Milliseconds` duration. The
minimum acceptable value equates to the `bottom` `DateTime` and the maximum
acceptable value equates to the `top` `DateTime`.
declarations.title: instant

declarations.comments: Lowers an `Instant` to a `Milliseconds` duration.
declarations.title: unInstant

declarations.comments: Creates an `Instant` from a `DateTime` value.
declarations.title: fromDateTime

declarations.comments: Creates a `DateTime` value from an `Instant`.
declarations.title: toDateTime

declarations.comments:
A date/time locale specifying an offset in minutes and an optional name for
the locale.
declarations.title: Locale

declarations.comments: The name of a date/time locale. For example: "GMT", "MDT", "CET", etc.
declarations.title: LocaleName

declarations.comments:
A value that is subject to a `Locale`.

There are `Functor`, `Extend`, and `Comonad` instances for `LocalValue` to
enable the inner non-localised value to be manipulated while maintaining
the locale.
declarations.title: LocalValue

declarations.comments: A date value with a locale.
declarations.title: LocalDate

declarations.comments: A time value with a locale.
declarations.title: LocalTime

declarations.comments: A date/time value with a locale.
declarations.title: LocalDateTime

declarations.comments:
An second component for a time value.

The constructor is private as values for the type are restricted to the
range 0 to 59, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire an `Second` value from an integer. Correspondingly, a `Second` can
be lowered to a plain integer with the `fromEnum` function.
declarations.title: Second

declarations.title: Hour

declarations.comments: The hour component of a time value.
declarations.title: hour

declarations.comments: Alters the hour component of a time value.
declarations.title: setHour

declarations.comments: The minute component of a time value.
declarations.title: minute

declarations.comments: Alters the minute component of a time value.
declarations.title: setMinute

declarations.comments: The second component of a time value.
declarations.title: second

declarations.comments: Alters the second component of a time value.
declarations.title: setSecond

declarations.comments: The millisecond component of a time value.
declarations.title: millisecond

declarations.comments: Alters the millisecond component of a time value.
declarations.title: setMillisecond

declarations.comments:
Adjusts a time value with a duration offset. The result includes a
remainder value of the whole number of days involved in the adjustment,
for example, if a time of 23:00:00:00 has a duration of +2 hours added to
it, the result will be 1 day, and 01:00:00:00. Correspondingly, if the
duration is negative, a negative number of days may also be returned as
the remainder.
declarations.title: adjust

declarations.comments:
Calculates the difference between two times, returning the result as a
duration.
declarations.title: diff

declarations.comments:
An hour component for a time value.

The constructor is private as values for the type are restricted to the
range 0 to 23, inclusive. The `toEnum` function can be used to safely
acquire an `Hour` value from an integer. Correspondingly, an `Hour` can be
lowered to a plain integer with the `fromEnum` function.
declarations.title: Hour

declarations.title: Millisecond

declarations.comments: A duration measured in milliseconds.
declarations.title: Milliseconds

declarations.comments: A duration measured in seconds.
declarations.title: Seconds

declarations.comments: A duration measured in minutes.
declarations.title: Minutes

declarations.comments: A duration measured in hours.
declarations.title: Hours

declarations.comments: A duration measured in days, where a day is assumed to be exactly 24 hours.
declarations.title: Days

declarations.comments: A class for enabling conversions between duration types.
declarations.title: Duration

declarations.comments: Converts directly between durations of differing types.
declarations.title: convertDuration
